name: Population
description: Population counts include all inhabitants or citizesn of a territory. The populaiton size changes depending on births, deaths & migraiton.
title: Population

name: GDP total
description: The total value of everything produced in a coutnry in a year, expressed in Internaitonaly comparable prices which are adjutsed for price differences and inflation over time.
title: Size of economy

name: GDP per capita
description: The average income per person per year, is rougly the same as GDP per capita. These numbers are expressed in a currency called Internaitonal Dollars which are adjutsed for price differences and inflation.
title: Income

name: Gini
description: Gini shows, with a single number, the income inequality of a complete populaiton. The most extreme situaitons explains how it works. If everybody have the same income, gini is zero. There is no inequality. If a single person or houshold earns all the income, and the rest of the populaiotn has nothing, then Gini is 1. IN reality gini is of course somewhere between those extremes.
title: Inequality

name: Life expectancy
description: Life expectancy shows the health situation in a populaiton at a given point in time, expressed as the expectaitons for a new-born: A child born this year, how long can she expect to live if the risks of dying at different ages remains as they currently are.
title: Health

name: Child mortality rate
description: Under-five mortality rate is the probability per 100 that a newborn baby will die before reaching age five, if subject to age-specific mortality rates of the specified year.
title: Child health

name: Babies per woman
description: Total fertility rate represents the number of children that would be born to a woman if she were to live to the end of her childbearing years and bear children in accordance with current age-specific fertility rates.
title: Babies

name: Child mortality rate (per 1000)
description: Under-five mortality rate is the probability per 1000 that a newborn baby will die before reaching age five, if subject to age-specific mortality rates of the specified year.
definition_snippet: deaths before age 5 per 1000 live births
title: Child deaths

name: CO2 emission per capita
definition_snippet: Metric tonnes per person per year
title: CO2
